Thanks John. The 3-leaf sukashi (if that what it is) does resemble kiri leaves but I wanted to hear that from somebody else. The strange patina is just the quality of the photo...probably a scan. Oddly, that off-color shows up the black lacquer, at least I think that's what I'm seeing on the posted view. I find this rather fascinating little tsuba, my reason for seeking some feedback from fresh eyes. 

I'm going to send a couple "tests" out after this email. Strange, my nihontostudy email and yahoo email both came back here and was dumped into my spam folder. No replies needed for the "test." 

Ron
STL
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: excelsiorilluminati 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, March 19, 2008 4:22 PM
  Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: Tsuba kantie


  Hi Ron, A rather strange patina. Looks brassy coloured in areas. 
  Lighting probably, eh? The sukashi look to be kirimon in shape. Don't 
  know about the ovals. Nice for a change, from marugata. John

  --- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Ron Hartmann" <swords@...> 
  wrote:
  >
  > Hi - 
  > 
  > I'm seeking some comments on an interesting old tsuba in my 
  collection. It is iron sukashi work of a very unusual (undescribable, 
  to me) shape and design. It measures 70mm x 58mm x 6mm and has 
  remnants of black lacquer remaining on it. The hitsu-ana pillows are 
  interesting in that hey are double-layered, the inside inlay being 
  shakudo with a silver overlaid plate. The tsuba has not been cut 
  down so this is its original shape, in my opinion. Obviously it has 
  been refitted many times. A photo is posted in nihontostudy pictures 
  under Ron STL. (posted under two groups...so one should work for 
  you.)
  > 
  > http://tinyurl.com/2vyzfc
  > 
  > http://tinyurl.com/2z2u8j
  > 
  > Any and all comments welcomed.
  > 
  > Ron
  > STL
